Hôtel de Salm
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Rousseau, Pierre (French architect, 1751-1810) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Hôtel de Salm was a favorite of Thomas Jefferson, who singled it out as a model for the American public buildings of Washington, DC. He had observed its construction during his stay in Paris in 1784–1789, and his design for Monticello, his own estate, was based on it. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palais_de_la_L%C3%A9gion_d%27Honneur [work]
